intro: Epilobium decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, pink to purple, and arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Epilobium decipiens is typically an annual or biennial herb, growing to a height of about 30–100 centimeters.
